metadata.Title: CVE-2019-18680 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 4.4.x before 4.4.195. There isa NULL pointer dereference in rds_tcp_kill_sock() in net/rds/tcp.c thatwill cause denial of service, aka CID-91573ae4aed0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1062.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.10.0-1004.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1125.134
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1129.137
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.134').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.137').
